intro: Miquelina evenia, commonly known as the silverleaf miquelina, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
